title: Propose a Java variant of protoc

labels.name: triage/duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: kind/epic
labels.description: Large issue with links to sub-issues

body:
### Description

`protoc` is a tool generating source code from `.proto` files. 
This tool is implemented in C or C++, and requires to be downloaded by the user (Quarkus does that automatically), but we need the proper architecture. It is not necessarily easy to find the right one.

Also, the tool does not provide a great flexibility in how the java classes are generated (final classes and so on). 

This epic is about investigating the possibility to replace `protoc` (as an option) with a full java approach. 

### Analysis

https://github.com/square/wire provides most of the things we need. This could be coupled with Qute to provide good templating support.

This alternative would be an option. `protoc` would still be supported.
